title: gloo subtree has submodule, which causes submodule init to fail
body_html:
Steps to reproduce:

  1. Clone PyTorch repo
  2. Run git submodule init

Expected result: Works

Actual result:

fatal: No url found for submodule path 'torch/lib/gloo/third-party/googletest' in .gitmodules

I wrote up about the issue here: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45422693/how-to-use-git-repo-with-submodule-nested-in-subtree

One "easy" way to fix this is to copy the .gitmodules to the top level of the repo and modify the paths so the are correct. If people are ok with this I can PR it.

body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Clone PyTorch repo
2. Run `git submodule init`

Expected result: Works

Actual result: 

```
fatal: No url found for submodule path 'torch/lib/gloo/third-party/googletest' in .gitmodules
```

I wrote up about the issue here: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45422693/how-to-use-git-repo-with-submodule-nested-in-subtree

One "easy" way to fix this is to copy the .gitmodules to the top level of the repo and modify the paths so the are correct. If people are ok with this I can PR it.
